Fifth Anniversary of Buddhist Headquarters Commemorated in S. Korea
articles.content:
Fifth Anniversary of Buddhist Headquarters Commemorated in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of commemorating the fifth anniversary of the Headquarters of Buddhist Jogye Order for the Promotion of the National Community (Minchubon) in south Korea was reportedly held in Seoul on June 29 with the attendance of Buddhist officials, Han Sang Ryol, permanent representative-chairman of the Reunification Solidarity, Chairman Ri Kyu Jae and Honorary Chairman Ri Jong Rin of the South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification (Pomminryon) and representatives of other reunification movement organizations.
 Speakers at the ceremony said that the religionists have struggled for the peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula together with reunification movement organizations and that Minchubon should conduct more vigorous activities for inter-Korean exchange and cooperation.    
 The congratulatory messages read out at the ceremony called upon the religionists in the south and the north to strive for the peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Halt to U.S. Instigation for War Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Halt to U.S. Instigation for War Demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in a statement on June 28 said that if the U.S. truly wants dialogue, it should immediately halt its instigation for a war under the pretext of "human rights", though belatedly, according to a press report.
 The statement said that the U.S. has still posed a threat of war against the north and aggravated tensions on the Korean Peninsula under the pretext of the "nuclear issue of the north" and "human rights issue".    
 The U.S. has never missed every opportunity without saying that it wants the resumption and progress of the six-party talks and it recognizes the north as a sovereign state, but it clearly shows that it is nothing but hypocrisy, the statement said.

Greetings to Rwandan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Rwandan President
    Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on July 1 sent a message of greetings to Rwandan President Paul Kagame on the occasion of the national day of the country.
 Expressing the belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would further develop in the future, he wished the president and the people of Rwanda greater success in their work for peace, stability and socio-economic development of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Belorussian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Belorussian President
    Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Belorussian President Aleksandr Lukashenko on the occasion of the national day and the 61st anniversary of liberation of Belarus from fascist Germany.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the mutual interests, he sincerely wished the president greater success in his responsible work for socio-political stability and unity of the country and the people's welfare.

Unreasonable Suppression of Trade Union Denounced
articles.content:
Unreasonable Suppression of Trade Union Denounced
    Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The National Government Employees' Union of south Korea called a press conference on June 28, at which it denounced the government for its suppression of the union, according to the south Korean MBC.
 Saying that the union is a lawful organization recognized by the international organization, it demanded the authorities discontinue the crackdown upon it and reinstate the government employees who were dismissed after the general strike last year.
